alert.note: Alert for De Witt; Karnes (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 5:44PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern DeWitt and southeastern Karnes Counties through 630 PM CDT... At 544 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Westhoff to near Runge to near Karnes City. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kenedy, Karnes City, Yorktown, Runge, Nordheim, Arneckville, Cotton Patch, Gruenau, New Davy, Helena, Choate, and Meyersville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
